title: expand go installation instructions
body:
by **john.a.fries**: 
go to http://golang.org/doc/install.html
go to the "Environment Variables" section.
We should include a note saying how the user can determine if their system is 64 bit or
32 bit (and hence whether they need to set GOARCH to amd64 or 386/arm.

The following works on my system:
cat /proc/cpuinfo | egrep "flags.*\slm(\s|$)"

If it prints out anything, then your system is 64 bit, if not then it is 32 bit.

My experience is that newbie users often don't understand how to check this kind of
thing, and we don't want to turn people away at the door.
